pageContext.claim: “I know nothing about him. And I don't know what's gonna happen. I guess the concept is perhaps he's a reporter type and you know The New York Times is doing the same thing, maybe, and The Washington Post, maybe the same thing and lots of others. So I just don't know very much about him.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump claims he knows nothing about Julian Assange, the head of Wikileaks who was arrested in England to face a charge in the United States of conspiring to hack into a Pentagon computer network in 2010. Yet Trump repeatedly cited Wikileaks during the 2016 presidential campaign when it disclosed Democratic emails obtained through Russian hacking operations. Here, he equates Wikileaks with traditional journalists, though prosecutors appeared to be trying to avoid a potential First Amendment minefield because traditional journalistic activity does not extend to helping a source break a code to gain illicit access to a classified network.
